result.execSummary:
The defendant Beainca Q Roberson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Beainca Q Roberson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Beainca Q Roberson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Beainca Q Roberson was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*NO contact with firearms.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with victim.  
*Defendant to not leave any child unsupervised.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Attend parenting classes.
*Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
*Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
*Cooperate with all Bureau of Child Welfare Orders.
*Court found that the defendant is indigent and therefore, waived all other costs and surcharges.
*Pay supervision fees.
*Defense request for expungement is denied by the court.

*AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
*Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beainca Q Roberson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Beainca Q Roberson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 months as to count 1 and 6 months as to count 3 in the House of Correction, consecutive,  with credit for -0- days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:

- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Cooperate with all Bureau of Child Welfare Orders.
- Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with victim.  Defendant to not leave any child unsupervised.
- No contact with firearms.
- Court found that the defendant is indigent and therefore, waived all other costs and surcharges.
- Pay supervision fees.
Defense request for expungement is denied by the court.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Jury trial is vacated.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Beainca Q Roberson in court with Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1 and Count 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2 and Count 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 and Count 4 DISMISSED.

Due to court calendar congestion, Court is unable to proceed to sentencing on today's date.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Clerk:  jms

Received and filed:
List of Witnesses for the Defense.
cab

Defendant Beainca Q Roberson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties inform the court that this case is continued to trial on 08/31/2015 at 08:30 a.m..
Received and filed:
State's motion in limine.

All offers are revoked.

Defendant Beainca Q Roberson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for bail/bond hearing. Defendant out of custdoy, defense no longer wishes to argue bail. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourend to branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Zovan R.; ZR dob 12/10/14; NR dob 4/18/13; DR dob 3/17/11, unless approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

Defendant Beainca Q Roberson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Beainca Q Roberson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.   Defense moves to dismiss Count 4.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss Count 4.  Defense makes separate motion to dismiss Counts 2 & 3.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss Counts 2 & 3.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
